page.title: 17Inustry around Rhos
page.content: In the past inustry has largely depended upon the natural resources of the area such as coal and clay.Coal mining is exausted in this area although some residents still work at the nearby Bersham Colliery Clay however still supports a thriving and continually developing industry.In the south eastern part of our area massive deposits of clay have been found.This clay is suitable for making tiles.The clay is up using big machines and is transported to the nearby tile works.The tile works opened 109 years ago and have been extesivly modernised.About 150 people are enployed at the works which produces 100000 floor tiles a day. When clay comes from the claypit it is ground up and then remixed before being forced through a narrow slit onto a conveyor belt.
